meanings.definition: Wave or flourish (something, especially a weapon) as a threat or in anger or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The pirate would brandish his sword to scare off enemies.
meanings.sent2: She brandished her pen in frustration during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would brandish his toy sword, pretending to be a brave knight.
meanings.sent4: The magician brandished his wand, casting spells with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent5: The knight brandished his sword, ready to defend the castle.

meanings.definition: Display or show off (something) in a bold or dramatic manner.
meanings.sent1: The model would brandish her new dress on the runway.
meanings.sent2: He brandished his trophy proudly after winning the competition.
meanings.sent3: The peacock would brandish its colorful feathers to impress the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The artist brandished his latest painting, eager for feedback.
meanings.sent5: The actor brandished his talent on stage, captivating the audience.
